title: Tonto National Monument: Park Home
body: Quintessential Arizona  The Salado Phenomena, 700 years ago, blended ideas of neighboring Native American cultures to emerge a unique and vibrant society. Tonto National Monument showcases two Salado-style cliff dwellings. Colorful pottery, woven cotton cloth, and other artifacts tell a story of people living and using resources from the northern Sonoran Desert from 1250 to 1450 CE.                Booking an Upper Cliff Dwelling Tour   Find out how to reserve a spot on the Upper Cliff Dwelling Tour. It is 3 to 4 hours long and offered November to April.         Planning Your Visit to Tonto?   Find out more how to visit Tonto National Monument. Discover how to hike to the Upper or Lower Cliff Dwellings. See the new museum exhibit.         Culture and Nature of Tonto NM   Learn more about the cliff dwellings and surrounding area. How does the desert landscape effect both natural and human life?            Centennial Birthday Bash!   Join Tonto National Monument in celebrating the 100th birthday of the National Park Service.
